go_data.justification: Osteopontin is closely related to cholelithiasis and plays a significant role in the pathogenesis of gallstone disease.
The mRNA OPN expression showed a significant increase in the hepatic tissue of gallstone-formed rabbits.
OPN has participated in a different number of physiological processes including the organizing of bone formation/resorption.
OPN has participated in a different number of physiological processes including the organizing of the immune system.
Osteopontin promotes rat hepatocyte proliferation both in vitro and in vivo.
